result.execSummary:
The defendant William C. Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant William C. Cooper in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant William C. Cooper in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. parties have received PSI no corrections, court orders PSI & VIS both into same envelope and confidential/sealed.  DA requested other document sealed - denied;  Victims Mother  -S Butler -   makes statement: Victims Grandmother  -Kerry  -   makes statement:  Shaylene B - sister - makes statement;  PL exh #1 CD with 2 photos O/R;  PL exh #2 - CD of confession  O/R 
Court sentences DEF to 15 years prison  10  years initial confinement  credit for 235 days, followed by 5  years extended supervision  conditions  restitution $ 74,514.62  plus surcharges, costs $268.00, provide health insurance, care and support to I Butler and S Butler.    Write letter and have Published in Sawyer County Record at victim's Mothers discretion:  outlining his full responsibility regarding this case - send to DOC 1st then to victim Mother - complete within 20 days .  No contact with child or Mother of child,  AODA,   complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent after COMPASS   Cognitive Group Intervention Program - Critical Thinking Program.  DNA Sample

Defendant William C. Cooper in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; victim present in court parties stipulate to facts DEF pleads guilty found guilty, court revokes bond - go to jail until sentencing  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Motion and Order to Withdraw as Attorney

Defendant William C. Cooper in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney McLaughlin motions to withdraw from 14CF19 specifically along with the others.    Mr. Cooper does not object to withdraw.  State makes no comment.  Court grants motion to withdraw.  PD needs to supply substitute counsel.  Bail continues. Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant William C. Cooper in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant William C. Cooper in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Off the Record -  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William C. Cooper in court, in custody with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Moldenhauer motions to withdraw as counsel.  Defendant would like to hire a new attorney.  Court grants motion to withdraw.   Attorney Moldenhauer states he will contact Public Defender's Office.   Defendant brings up bail modification and asks for reduction.  Reads statement.  State opposes bond modification in these cases.  State asks that the bond continue as previously set.  Court goes through records.  Defendant's motion to modify bond is denied.  Bond remains.

Defendant William C. Cooper in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant William C. Cooper in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF wants to hire private counsel, motion to withdraw - DENIED by court, DEF wants to talk to court in person, state objects.  Court DEF needs to file appropriate motion, none filed yet.
